About Me

Hi there! My name is Epifanio Torres, but you can call me Epi! I just graduated from Princeton University as part of the Great Class of 2022. During my studies at Princeton, I majored in computer science and minored in Spanish Language and Culture.

How I Got Started

Going into college, I had no idea what I wanted to study (or really what I wanted to do with my life). Even though I enjoyed using computers and playing PC games, I had no programming experience prior to starting my studies at Princeton. Deciding that I wanted to give programming a whirl, I signed up for Princeton‚Äôs introductory computer science class during my first semester. As I worked on simulating graviational forces and programming a virtual guitar as part of this class, I began to realize how much computer science fascinated me.

The summer after my first year of college, I was chosen to participate in Princeton Summer Programming Experiences, which focused on providing learning opportunities for students who were new to computer science. By the end of the six-week program, I had codeveloped a 3D video game and felt extremely proud of how much my programming skills had improved. Not too long afterwards, I decided to major in computer science to continue making cool applications, like video games and websites!

Projects

Below you can find information about all of the projects that I have undertaken over the past few years. Check them out!

Into Another Dimension (2022) by Epi Torres Into Another Dimension is a proof-of-concept project that implements a 4D physics engine and 4D rendering pipeline in Unity. Interact with hyperspheres, hyperboxes, and hypercapsules in this mind-boggling prototype! Code Demo
Game Bot (2021) by Epi Torres Game Bot is a project aimed at teaching programmers how to implement two reinforcement learning algorithms in Python in order to train a bot that plays Google Chrome's Dinosaur Game. Program and train your very own dino bot below! Code Demo
Core Crawler (2021) by Epi Torres & Jorge Zreik Core Crawler is a low-poly 3D video game where you are an astronaut exploring the center of a planet with only your grappling hook to get around. Swing through the procedurally generated world while you collect gems to increase your score while trying not to crash! Code Demo
Lucid (2019) by Epi Torres & Will Svoboda Lucid is a 3D first-person platformer where you are trapped in a tropical dream world. Collect hidden items throughout this world to craft different abilities to help you reach new areas and ultimately escape! Code Demo
